result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan L Kainz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 82 days sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF5268, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs and DNA surcharge.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
AODA assessement and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant is not to have contact with his mother unless she allows and then no violent contact.
Defendant is NOT to reside with his mother.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) release for work, treatment/counseling.
LAST 3 MONTHS are STAYED and are to be use at Agent's discretion. 
Agent to determine with or without non-working hours (Huber).
Consecutive to: Case 15CF5268.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bryan L Kainz in court, in custody, with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1. Counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT, consecutive to 15CF5268 (82 days credit, if revoked)
  -   4 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with his mother unless she allows and then no violent contact
*Deft. is not to reside with his mother
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 6 months huber consecutive to 15CF5268 (work, treatment/counseling), the last 3 months are STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant can be returned to Milwaukee County
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bryan L Kainz in court, in custody, with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Atty. Kuhary advises that there will need to be an order to produce for his client from Milwaukee House of Corrections for the next hearing date.  Atty. Kuhary is also requesting the cash bail posted in this matter be refunded to the party who paid it.  State does not object.  Court orders bail refunded to the payor.  Cash bail previously ordered will remain in place.  Court will also address the Court appointed attorney payment plan.  Court will order the payment obligation for Mr. Kainz is currently suspended pending incarceration, matter may be readdressed before the Judge at the next hearing date.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
